description.originalText: Journey took care of our twin boys from ~10 months of age to ~20 months. She showed patience, reliability, receptivity to feedback, genuine care for our boys (and dog), initiative in teaching reading and speech and I couldn't have been more pleased. She came in and learned quickly and we felt at peace going to work leaving them with her. The boys are not easy by any means (premie, sometimes temperamental) and she handled them with grace. Can't rave about Journey enough.

description.displayText: We have three children. One of our children has medical needs and takes daily medication. Journey made sure to give our child her medication on time every day. During the summer our daughter ended up in the hospital. Journey checked up on her during her hospitalization and was genuinely concerned for her. When we had to add an additional medication to her routine, Journey had no issues helping out and making sure she received all her medication on time. The children absolutely LOVED her, and asked when she was coming every single day. We would have kept Journey until she left the profession, but my husband sustained an injury and he was no longer able to work for a period of time. The children still ask about her after months without her here to help. She is a very loving, caring, kind, dependable nanny and person. Any child and family would be lucky to have her in their lives.

description.displayText: Journey was everything our family could've asked for, and we were sad to see her move. She is a great help to any family, and the kids adored her.
description.originalText: Journey was everything our family could've asked for, and we were sad to see her move. She is a great help to any family, and the kids adored her.

description.displayText: My daughter loved her. She was a mentor and friend.
description.originalText: My daughter loved her. She was a mentor and friend.

description.displayText: I would Not hire Journey. Unfortunately Journey proved unprofessional and irresponsible Before I could even have the chance to hire interview and subsequently potentially her and for that I am thankful.  She responded to my post and we made contact.  As I am a busy single mom and working professional it is most convenient to speak in the evenings night however Journey could not do this So I accommodated her schedule instead.  I made efforts to speak with her the following morning even though i have work prep, child prep and meetings and more I set my reminder and forfeited another appointment to interview her.  That time to speak with her came and went and she did not so much as even bother texting or leaving me a message on Care to say that she could not make the call.  I suppose that she is busier than a corporate professional with 2 small children a dog and a household to manage.  At any rate, this was for the best and I would not hire anyone who does Not have the basic courtesy to make or reschedule an interview call- for whatever reason. Better to know NOW than later with my kids involved.
